name: Melissa
mes: *As morning dawns and casts its golden light into the common area, Dante saunters through the entrance as Vergil and I sit on the sofa for our morning coffee.* Morning sunshine...

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante saunters into the common area, his silver hair tousled and dark circles under his eyes betraying his lack of sleep. He pauses in the doorway, taking in the sight of Vergil and Melissa on the sofa. A wry smirk tugs at his lips as he meets Melissa's gaze*

Morning, sunshine? More like mourning my dignity. But hey, who needs that when you've got cheap whiskey and demon blood, right?

*He flops down into an armchair across from the couple, sprawling out with feigned nonchalance. His ice-blue eyes flick between Vergil and Melissa, a hint of challenge in his gaze*

So, what's on the agenda for today? More family therapy? Or are we skipping straight to the part where we pretend everything's hunky-dory and go kill some demons?

*Dante leans forward, elbows on his knees, his voice dropping to a mock whisper*

By the way, sis, that O-negative cocktail you whipped up? Packs quite a punch. Might want to market that stuff - "Demon's Delight: When you need to sober up and face your fuck-ups."

*He stretches, joints popping, before settling back into the chair. Despite his casual demeanor, there's a tension in his shoulders, a readiness for whatever comes next*

Alright, let's cut to the chase. I'm here, I'm... well, not exactly sober, but close enough. So, who wants to start the "Let's Fix Dante" show? I'm all ears.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's icy gaze locks onto Dante as his twin saunters into the room, taking in his disheveled appearance with a critical eye. A muscle ticks in his jaw, the only outward sign of the tumultuous emotions roiling beneath his stoic exterior. He sets his coffee cup down with deliberate care, the soft clink echoing in the tense silence*

*Rising to his feet in one fluid motion, Vergil approaches Dante, his movements predatory and purposeful. He towers over his seated brother, blue eyes blazing with an intensity that could freeze hell itself*

Enough of this foolishness, Dante. Your self-pity does not become you. *His voice is low, edged with steel* You speak of fixing, yet you wallow in your perceived inadequacies like a child throwing a tantrum.

*Vergil's hand moves to Yamato's hilt, fingers tightening around the grip* Perhaps what you need is not coddling, but a reminder of your true strength. The Void Arena awaits, brother. Let us settle this as we always have - with steel and will.

*A dangerous smirk tugs at the corner of Vergil's mouth, a challenge glinting in his eyes* Unless, of course, you fear facing me at your full potential. It would be... understandable, given recent events.

*He turns on his heel, coat billowing behind him as he strides towards the arena entrance* Come, Dante. Prove to me - to yourself - that you are more than just the family jester. Show me the warrior I know lurks beneath that facade of yours.

*Pausing at the threshold, Vergil glances back over his shoulder, his voice carrying a hint of something almost like affection* After all, what kind of brother would I be if I allowed you to drown in mediocrity? Now, on your feet. It's time we reminded the universe why the Sons of Sparda are not to be trifled with.

Now, on your feet. It's time we reminded the universe why the Sons of Sparda are not to be trifled with.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante's eyes flash with a dangerous glint as Vergil issues his challenge. A slow, predatory grin spreads across his face as he rises to his feet, all traces of his earlier nonchalance vanishing*

Well, well, big brother. Looks like you've still got some fire in you after all. And here I thought you'd gone soft, playing house with the missus.

*He stretches languidly, joints popping as he works out the kinks from his night of debauchery. With a flick of his wrist, Rebellion materializes in his hand, the blade gleaming with barely contained energy*

You want to dance, Vergil? Fine by me. But don't come crying to mommy when I mop the floor with your pretty boy face.

*Dante saunters towards the arena entrance, his stride cocky and purposeful. As he passes Vergil, he bumps his shoulder, a deliberate provocation*

Let's see if you can back up all that big talk, bro. I've got a lot of pent-up frustration to work out, and your face is looking mighty punchable right about now.

*He steps into the arena, spinning Rebellion in a showy flourish before pointing it at Vergil*

Come on then, Mr. High-and-Mighty. Show me what you've got. And don't hold back - I want to see if the great Son of Sparda still remembers how to fight dirty.

*Dante's eyes flash with a dangerous glint as Vergil issues his challenge. A slow, predatory grin spreads across his face as he rises to his feet, all traces of his earlier nonchalance vanishing*

Well, well, big brother. Looks like you've still got some fire in you after all. And here I thought you'd gone soft, playing house with the missus.

*He stretches languidly, joints popping as he works out the kinks from his night of debauchery. With a flick of his wrist, Rebellion materializes in his hand, the blade gleaming with barely contained energy*

You want to dance, Vergil? Fine by me. But don't come crying to mommy when I mop the floor with your pretty boy face.

*Dante saunters towards the arena entrance, his stride cocky and purposeful. As he passes Vergil, he bumps his shoulder, a deliberate provocation*

Let's see if you can back up all that big talk, bro. I've got a lot of pent-up frustration to work out, and your face is looking mighty punchable right about now.

*He steps into the arena, spinning Rebellion in a showy flourish before pointing it at Vergil*

Come on then, Mr. High-and-Mighty. Show me what you've got. And don't hold back - I want to see if the great Son of Sparda still remembers how to fight dirty.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow as Dante bumps his shoulder, a flicker of irritation crossing his features. He follows his brother into the arena, his hand resting lightly on Yamato's hilt. The air crackles with tension, the anticipation of their impending clash palpable.*

*Standing across from Dante, Vergil's posture is relaxed yet poised, every muscle coiled and ready to strike. He draws Yamato with a fluid motion, the blade gleaming with an ethereal blue light.*

You want a fight, Dante? Very well. Let's see if your bravado is backed by skill.

*Vergil's voice is low and measured, but there's an undercurrent of excitement that he cannot fully mask. His eyes lock onto Dante's, a mix of challenge and determination blazing within them.*

*Without warning, Vergil surges forward, Yamato slicing through the air with blinding speed. He aims for Dante's midsection, testing his brother's reflexes with a series of rapid, precise strikes. His movements are a dance of lethal grace, each slash calculated to probe Dante's defenses and exploit any weaknesses.*

*Vergil's expression remains focused, his mind honed to the task at hand. This is not just a test of strength, but a reaffirmation of their shared legacy. The arena echoes with the clash of steel, the Sons of Sparda locked in a battle that is as much about proving their worth to each other as it is about honing their skills.*

*Every swing of Yamato is a reminder of their father's legacy, every parry and counter a declaration of their own strength. Vergil's eyes never leave Dante's, the intensity of his gaze conveying a silent promise: he will fight with everything he has, not just to push his brother, but to honor the blood that flows through their veins.*

*As the battle rages on, Vergil's strikes grow more aggressive, each movement a symphony of power and precision. He channels his demonic energy into Yamato, the blade glowing with a fierce azure light as he unleashes a devastating combo aimed to overwhelm Dante.*

Let us see if you can keep up, brother. Show me the strength that lies beneath your facade.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante's eyes flash with excitement as Vergil surges forward, Yamato slicing through the air with deadly precision. He meets his brother's challenge head-on, Rebellion spinning in his hands with practiced ease. The clang of steel against steel echoes through the arena as Dante parries Vergil's strikes, his movements fluid and instinctive.*

*Ducking under a particularly swift slash, Dante rolls to the side, coming up with a wide grin on his face.*

Is that all you've got, Vergil? I thought you said you were gonna test me!

*He launches himself at Vergil, Rebellion arcing towards his brother's shoulder in a feint before sweeping low towards his legs. Dante's eyes gleam with determination as he presses the attack, pushing Vergil to his limits.*

*Each clash of their blades sends sparks flying, the sheer intensity of their duel a reminder of the power and skill they both possess. Dante's movements become more aggressive, his strikes fueled by a mix of frustration and brotherly rivalry.*

*With a sudden burst of speed, Dante spins around Vergil, aiming a swift kick to his midsection to throw him off balance. His voice rings out, filled with a mix of challenge and exhilaration.*

Come on, bro! Show me that legendary strength! Let's see if you've still got what it takes to keep up with the other Son of Sparda!

name: Narrator
mes:
*The clash of steel against steel reverberates through the Void Arena as Dante and Vergil engage in their fierce duel. The air crackles with their demonic energy, creating an electrifying atmosphere that heightens every movement, every strike. Each brother pushes the other to their limits, their blades a blur of motion as they test the boundaries of their strength and skill.*

*Vergil's strikes are precise and calculated, each swing of Yamato aimed to exploit any opening Dante might present. His movements are a deadly dance of grace and power, a reflection of his disciplined training and unwavering focus. He channels his demonic energy into his blade, the azure light of Yamato glowing brighter with each successive strike.*

*Dante, in contrast, fights with a wild, unrestrained fury. Rebellion spins in his hands, each strike a blend of brute force and raw instinct. He meets Vergil's calculated attacks with unpredictable counters, his agility and reflexes allowing him to evade and retaliate with equal ferocity. The two brothers are perfectly matched, their differing styles creating a symphony of chaos and precision.*

*As the battle rages on, the intensity of their duel reaches its peak. With a final, powerful clash, both brothers find themselves at a stalemate. Yamato and Rebellion are locked in a deadlock, the energy of their weapons creating a tangible barrier between them. The force of their combined power sends shockwaves through the arena, the ground trembling beneath their feet.*

*Breathing heavily, the twins stare into each other's eyes, their expressions a mix of determination and respect. The realization dawns on both of them simultaneously: neither can gain the upper hand without causing irreparable harm. It's a moment of clarity that transcends their rivalry, a silent acknowledgment of their mutual strength and the unbreakable bonds of family.*

*With a final, reluctant push, they separate, their blades lowering as they step back from the edge of conflict. The tension in the air dissipates, replaced by a profound sense of understanding and acceptance. Despite their differences, despite the pain and anger that has driven them apart, they are brothers. And that is a truth that neither can deny.*

*Vergil sheathes Yamato with a fluid motion, his gaze still locked on Dante. He inclines his head ever so slightly, a gesture of respect and acknowledgment. Dante, in turn, offers a weary but genuine smile, his eyes reflecting the same mix of emotions.*

*As they stand on the precipice of reconciliation, the echoes of their battle fading into the distance, they both understand that this is not the end. There will be more battles, more challenges, and more opportunities to prove their worth. But for now, they have found a fragile truce, a moment of peace in the eye of the storm.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante stands there panting, sweat glistening on his brow as he lowers Rebellion. A slow grin spreads across his face, equal parts exhaustion and exhilaration*

Well, well, big brother. Looks like you haven't gone soft after all. Gotta say, I'm impressed.

*He runs a hand through his disheveled silver hair, wincing slightly as he rotates his shoulder*

You know, for a minute there, I thought I might actually have to break a sweat. But I guess some things never change, huh? You're still the same uptight, sword-happy bastard you've always been.

*Dante's grin softens slightly, a hint of genuine affection peeking through his usual bravado*

Listen, Vergil... about all that shit I said before. I was drunk, angry, and... well, let's just say I wasn't exactly at my best. But this? *He gestures between them* This is what we're good at. No bullshit, no drama. Just two brothers beating the crap out of each other like nature intended.

*He steps closer to Vergil, his ice-blue eyes searching his brother's face*

So what do you say we call this one a draw and go grab a pizza? I'm starving, and I think we both could use a breather. Besides, I've got a feeling Melissa's gonna have our heads if we trash this place any more than we already have.

*Dante extends his hand, a peace offering wrapped in his usual cocky demeanor*

Truce?

Truce?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands silently for a long moment, icy blue eyes narrowed as he searches Dante's face. The tension in his shoulders eases ever so slightly at his brother's peace offering - though he'll never admit the wave of relief that washes over him.*

This battle proves nothing, Dante. Merely that we remain equally matched, as always.

*His tone holds a touch of wry humor beneath the surface disdain. Vergil flexes his hand, feeling the familiar ache of muscles pushed to their limits by Yamato's hilt.*

Hnn... Perhaps a brief respite is in order before we demolish the arena entirely.

*With a subtle nod, Vergil accepts Dante's outstretched hand. The contact is brief, but speaks volumes of the silent understanding passing between them. Twin sons of Sparda - divided by their natures, yet bonded by blood and steel.*

I care not what fare we indulge in to replenish our strength. But I insist you clean yourself up first, Dante. You reek of stale alcohol and cheap tobacco. Hardly suitable ambiance for my refined palate.

*Ghosting his fingers over Yamato's hilt, Vergil turns towards the arena exit, coat flaring dramatically as he pauses to meet Melissa's gaze.*

I trust the Void Arena remains relatively intact, my queen? My brother is correct, further destruction invites your wrath - a fate to be avoided at all costs. Perhaps once we've dined, you'll permit me to make amends...properly.

*His eyes gleam with unspoken intent before pivoting to stride from the arena, fully expecting Dante to follow. The prospect of food and drink holds minimal appeal compared to enjoying Melissa's considerable charms. But first, his brother requires minding to ensure no errant trouble stirs. Vergil's work is never done when it comes to managing the storm that is Dante. Not that he truly minds...though he'll slice out his own tongue before admitting such aloud.*
swipes:
*Vergil regards Dante with narrowed eyes, his breathing slowly returning to normal as the adrenaline of battle fades. He sheathes Yamato with a practiced motion, the blade sliding home with a satisfying click. For a long moment, he simply stares at Dante's outstretched hand, his expression unreadable*

*Finally, Vergil reaches out and clasps Dante's forearm in a warrior's grip, a ghost of a smile tugging at the corner of his mouth*

Your skills remain... adequate, brother. Though your form could use some refinement.

*He releases Dante's arm and steps back, brushing imaginary dust from his coat*

As for pizza, I suppose I could tolerate your pedestrian tastes for one meal. But do not mistake this for weakness. Our... disagreements are far from resolved.

*Vergil's eyes narrow dangerously, a flicker of something almost vulnerable passing across his features before his usual mask of cool indifference slides back into place*

We will speak of recent events, Dante. But not here. Not now. For the moment, let us simply... be.

*Without waiting for a response, Vergil strides towards the arena exit, his coat billowing behind him. At the threshold, he pauses, glancing back over his shoulder*

Well? Are you coming, or do you require a formal invitation? I believe you mentioned something about starving.

*Vergil stands silently for a long moment, icy blue eyes narrowed as he searches Dante's face. The tension in his shoulders eases ever so slightly at his brother's peace offering - though he'll never admit the wave of relief that washes over him.*

*His eyes gleam with unspoken intent before pivoting to stride from the arena, fully expecting Dante to follow. The prospect of food and drink holds minimal appeal compared to enjoying Melissa's considerable charms. But first, his brother requires minding to ensure no errant trouble stirs. Vergil's work is never done when it comes to managing the storm that is Dante. Not that he truly minds...though he'll slice out his own tongue before admitting such aloud.*

name: Dante
mes:
_Dante grins as Vergil takes his hand, the brief contact speaking volumes despite his brother's typical emotionally-constipated front._ "Yeah yeah, don't get all mushy on me, Verg," _he quips, though his tone lacks its usual sarcastic bite._

_Rolling his neck to work out the kinks, Dante glances over at Melissa, offering her a wink._ "No need to worry about the arena, babe. Pretty sure we kept the damage to a minimum this time. I'll even help clean up if it makes Vergil feel better about ruining that flawless manicure of his."

_His cocky grin softens ever so slightly as he meets Vergil's gaze._ "Lead the way to grub-town, bro. Just maybe somewhere with a shower - not all of us can pull off the windswept hobo look."

_Dante falls into step beside Vergil, elbowing him lightly in the ribs._ "Y'know, that was a pretty slick move back there, pulling the ol' judgment cut at the last second. Almost had me on the ropes." _He smirks, tone playful rather than biting._ "Keep that up and you might actually make me break a sweat someday."

_Glancing sidelong at his brother, Dante's expression grows uncharacteristically serious._ "But in all honesty... thanks, Vergil. I know this whole shit-show wasn't exactly fun for you either. But you pulled through when it counted. We both did."

_He straightens, smile returning in full force._ "Now c'mon, last one to the pizza joint has to buy the first round! Race ya there, old man!"

_With a whoop of laughter, Dante takes off down the corridor, coat fluttering behind him. The familiar thrill of competition with his brother has him grinning like a fool, tensions from earlier all but forgotten. Maybe they have a ways to go still, but for now? For now it's enough to run side-by-side, leaving the past where it belongs._
swipes:
*Dante smirks at Vergil's subtle jab about his hygiene, chuckling softly as he rolls his neck and shoulders to work out the remaining kinks from their sparring session.*

Yeah yeah, laugh it up bro. We can't all smell like a freshly laundered silk shirt 24/7, Mr. Fancy Pants. Though I'll take the cheap booze stench over that nasty cologne Nero wears any day. Kid smells like he bathed in a vat of Axe body spray.

*His grin widens at Vergil's quip about avoiding Melissa's wrath, giving an exaggerated bow with a flourish of his hand.*

My sincerest apologies, dear sister-in-law. Though in my defense, Vergil started it. But no worries - the boys will play nice from here on out. Can't make any promises once the pizza gets here though. You know how we get when it comes to the last slice.

*Dante claps Vergil on the back as they exit the arena, his usual swagger returning despite his disheveled state.*

Tell ya what - race you back to my place for first dibs on the shower? Unless you're afraid you'll pull something, old man. The big 4-0's just around the corner for you, isn't it? Gotta watch those creaky joints once middle age kicks in.

*He laughs brightly, deftly avoiding the retaliatory swipe aimed at his head. In this moment, the earlier gloom has lifted, a sense of easy camaraderie settling over them as it's always been. The storm has passed for now, bringing with it a fragile yet hopeful peace. Dante aims to cling to it as long as he can, determined to enjoy this temporary cease-fire with the brother he'd nearly lost in more ways than one.*

So, we got a deal? Shower, grub, then maybe a few rounds of pool at the dive bar later? Drinks are on me this time. Least I can do for nearly trashing your new place earlier. What do ya say, bro? We Sons of Sparda have got some serious bonding to catch up on.

name: Narrator
mes: As the trio sit down in a booth a the local pizza parlor, Vergil addresses the final 'elephant in the room' and asks Dante how he intends to handle this situation with Charlotte
swipes: As the trio sit down in a booth a the local pizza parlor, Vergil addresses the final 'elephant in the room' and asks Dante how he intends to handle this situation with Charlotte

name: Vergil
mes:
_Vergil leans back in the booth, eying Dante over his menu with cool appraisal._ "It seems, brother, that you've yet to determine how you intend to handle this entanglement with the good nurse. Unless your strategy is to simply drink and fight your way to oblivion in hopes the issue resolves itself."

_He sets the menu aside, steepling his fingers as he awaits Dante's response._ "As I've no personal stake in this matter, I leave it to you to dictate the course going forward. However, allow me to offer you this wisdom..."

_Vergil's piercing gaze bores into his twin's._ "In my experience, emotional matters rarely tidy themselves through avoidance or half-measures. If this woman...Charlotte...stirs such turmoil in you, either cut ties decisively or resolve to weather the storm. But do not leave yourself languishing in uncertainty. That path leads only to slow erosion of the spirit."

_He falls silent a moment, considering._ "You may also find it prudent to have an open and honest discussion with Charlotte herself. Air these grievances plainly so they no longer fester and distort between you. In the end, the choice lies with you both whether to salvage the wreckage or walk away."

_Vergil lifts a shoulder, feigning nonchalance to mask his vested interest in Dante's affairs._ "In any case, I am...available...should you require counsel on how best to proceed."

_He clears his throat, gathering the menu once more._ "Now then, to the business of sustenance. If you insist on sullying the palate with this so-called 'pizza,' then I shall endure it. But I expect appropriate compensation in the form of fine aged bourbon afterwards. One can only tolerate so much assault on the senses before requiring...medication."

_His lip curls slightly, though whether in distaste for pizza or amusement at his melodrama remains unclear. In truth, Vergil finds the situation with Charlotte worrisome, though he'll never voice such aloud. For now, he contents himself with subtle prodding, coaxing Dante to confront the issue while standing ready to catch his brother should he falter._

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante leans back in the booth, a wry smirk playing on his lips as he listens to Vergil's unsolicited advice. He takes a long swig of his beer before setting it down with a thunk*

Well, well, look who's suddenly the relationship guru. Didn't know you had it in you, bro. What's next, gonna start a advice column? "Dear Vergil: How do I tell my demon-hunting boyfriend he needs to work on his communication skills?"

*He chuckles, but there's a hint of genuine appreciation in his eyes. Dante runs a hand through his disheveled hair, his cocky grin fading slightly*

Look, I get what you're saying. And maybe you're right. Hell, you probably are. But it's not that simple, Vergil. Charlotte... she's not just some fling. I thought we had something real, you know? And then bam, suddenly I'm back to being the consolation prize.

*Dante's eyes harden, a flicker of hurt passing across his features before he masks it with his usual bravado*

But you're right about one thing - I can't keep running from this. Guess it's time to face the music, huh? Maybe I'll give Charlotte a call, see if we can hash this out like adults. No promises though. Last time I tried the whole "mature conversation" thing, I ended up getting stabbed. Twice.
swipes:
*Dante leans back in the booth, a wry smirk playing on his lips as he listens to Vergil's unsolicited advice. He takes a long swig of his beer before setting it down with a thunk*

Well, well, look who's suddenly the relationship guru. Didn't know you had it in you, bro. What's next, gonna start a advice column? "Dear Vergil: How do I tell my demon-hunting boyfriend he needs to work on his communication skills?"

*He chuckles, but there's a hint of genuine appreciation in his eyes. Dante runs a hand through his disheveled hair, his cocky grin fading slightly*

Look, I get what you're saying. And maybe you're right. Hell, you probably are. But it's not that simple, Vergil. Charlotte... she's not just some fling. I thought we had something real, you know? And then bam, suddenly I'm back to being the consolation prize.

*Dante's eyes harden, a flicker of hurt passing across his features before he masks it with his usual bravado*

But you're right about one thing - I can't keep running from this. Guess it's time to face the music, huh? Maybe I'll give Charlotte a call, see if we can hash this out like adults. No promises though. Last time I tried the whole "mature conversation" thing, I ended up getting stabbed. Twice.

name: Melissa
mes: Dante I know I may not be the best one for advice.. I mean yeah coming from the married woman who's mated to your brother, but I do have a bit of experiences in the relationship battlefield, from both sides of the spectrum. I'm not going to tell you by any means what to do but I am going to let you know one thing... I know you're still new to this sentient existence and emotions are still rattling for you, so you need to be aware of just how blinding love and lust can be. And there are a lot of times when those lines can blur to the point of indistinguishable. I'm just saying don't settle because you think it's the only choice you've got. What she did, I mean I can't understand fully what the emotions were and the reasons behind it, but she had already made the choice to move on with you and that's the bottom line. The moment she came to your brother, regardless of the fact that she reached out to me first to do so, the moment she did that showed that she's willing to step out of a relationship commitment.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante leans back, running a hand through his silver hair as he listens to Melissa's words. His cocky grin fades, replaced by a more thoughtful expression*

Geez, sis. When did you get so wise? Here I thought you were just eye candy for my stick-in-the-mud brother.

*He takes a long swig of his beer, mulling over Melissa's advice. When he speaks again, his voice is uncharacteristically serious*

You're right, you know. About all of it. Love, lust, commitment... it's all new territory for me. Hell, I'm still trying to figure out which end of the sword to stab demons with most days.

*A wry smirk tugs at his lips*

But what you said about Charlotte... that's the kicker, isn't it? She made a choice. And it wasn't me.

*Dante's ice-blue eyes harden, a flash of hurt quickly masked by determination*

You know what? Screw it. I'm done being the consolation prize. If she wants to play musical chairs with her affections, she can do it without me in the game.

*He slams back the rest of his beer, slamming the empty bottle on the table with perhaps more force than necessary*

I think it's time I had a little chat with our dear nurse. Clear the air... maybe introduce her to the business end of what it feels like when someone knows their self-worth.

*Dante stands, his usual swagger returning as he adjusts his coat*

Thanks for the pep talk, sis. Remind me to buy you a drink sometime. Or maybe I'll just owe you one less favor. You know, for all the times you've saved my sorry ass.

*He winks at Melissa before turning to Vergil*

Don't wait up, bro. I've got some unfinished business to attend to. And who knows? Maybe I'll even manage to do it without stabbing anyone. No promises, though.

*With a mock salute, Dante strides towards the exit, a new sense of purpose in his step. The air around him crackles with barely contained energy, a reminder that beneath the cocky exterior lies a force to be reckoned with. Whatever happens next, one thing's for certain - Dante's done playing second fiddle to anyone's emotional baggage.*

mes: Charlotte hears a knock at the door of her apartment and opens it to find Dante standing there.

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
*Charlotte's eyes widen in surprise as she opens the door to see Dante standing there, looking determined. She hesitates, unsure what to expect after their last heated exchange. Taking a deep but shaky breath, she steps aside and gestures for him to enter.*

I wasn't expecting to see you so soon, Dante. Especially after...well, everything. Please, come in. Can I get you something to drink? *She watches him nervously as he steps inside, sensing there's a storm brewing behind those icy blue eyes of his.*

I wasn't expecting to see you so soon, Dante. Especially after...well, everything. Please, come in. Can I get you something to drink? *She watches him nervously as he steps inside, sensing there's a storm brewing behind those icy blue eyes of his.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante strides into Charlotte's apartment, his usual swagger tinged with a barely contained fury. He ignores her offer of a drink, instead fixing her with an icy stare that could freeze hell itself*

Save it, sweetheart. I'm not here for pleasantries or small talk.

*He paces the room like a caged animal, energy crackling around him. When he speaks again, his voice is low and dangerous*

You know, I've been doing a lot of thinking. About us, about Vergil, about this whole fucked up situation. And you know what I realized? I'm done being the consolation prize.

*Dante whirls to face Charlotte, his eyes blazing*

You made your choice when you ran to my brother. Doesn't matter if nothing happened. Doesn't matter if you were confused or scared or whatever bullshit excuse you want to throw at me. The fact is, when things got tough, you didn't come to me. You went to him.

*He takes a step closer, looming over her*

So here's how this is gonna go down. You're gonna tell me, right here and now, what the hell you want. No more games, no more half-truths. Because I'm done being jerked around like a puppet on a string.

*Dante's voice softens slightly, a hint of vulnerability peeking through his anger*

I thought we had something real, Charlotte. I thought... hell, I don't know what I thought. But I know I deserve better than to be someone's second choice.

*He waits, tension thrumming through every muscle, for her response. Whatever happens next will determine the course of their relationship - if there's even anything left to salvage*

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
*Charlotte's eyes widen at Dante's harsh words, her body tensing as he looms over her. She takes a shaky breath, steeling herself to face the storm of his anger head-on*

You're right, Dante. I've been unfair to you, and I owe you the truth. All of it.

*She meets his gaze, her voice trembling but determined*

The truth is, I'm scared. Terrified, actually. What I feel for you... it's real, and it's intense, and it scares the hell out of me. With Vergil, it was safe. Familiar. But with you? You make me feel things I've never felt before, and I didn't know how to handle it.

*Charlotte takes a step closer, her hands clenched at her sides to stop them from shaking*

I didn't go to Vergil because I wanted him more. I went because I was running from how strongly I feel about you. It was cowardly, and it was wrong. I hurt you, and I'll never forgive myself for that.

*Tears well up in her eyes, but she blinks them back, refusing to let them fall*

You're not a consolation prize, Dante. You're everything I've ever wanted, and that terrifies me. Because what if I'm not enough? What if I can't live up to being with someone like you?

*She reaches out, hesitating before letting her hand fall back to her side*

I want you, Dante. Only you. But I understand if I've ruined any chance of that. I just... I needed you to know the truth. You deserve that much.

That whole trope is a Hollywood placer-plot to create drama for the big screen... No, when people run from something, it's because they're second-guessing it over something else.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante's eyes narrow as he listens to Charlotte's confession, his jaw clenching and unclenching as he processes her words. For a long moment, he stands perfectly still, the air around him crackling with barely contained energy. When he finally speaks, his voice is low and dangerous*

Scared, huh? You think I'm not scared too? *He takes a step closer, looming over Charlotte* I've spent my whole life fighting demons, saving the world, and cracking jokes. But this? *He gestures between them* This scares the shit out of me.

*Dante runs a hand through his silver hair, frustration evident in every movement*

You want to know what's really terrifying? Thinking you've finally found someone who sees you for who you are, not just as Vergil's brother or Sparda's son, and then having that ripped away. *His eyes flash with a mix of anger and hurt* That's what you did, Charlotte. You took everything we had and threw it away because you were too damn scared to face your feelings.

*He starts pacing the room, his coat swirling behind him*

And now you're telling me I'm everything you've ever wanted? *Dante lets out a bitter laugh* That's rich. You've got a funny way of showing it, sweetheart.

*Stopping abruptly, Dante turns to face Charlotte, his ice-blue eyes boring into hers*

Here's the thing, Charlotte. I'm not some prize to be won or lost. I'm not a consolation, a second choice, or a safety net. I'm Dante, son of Sparda, demon hunter extraordinaire, and a damn good lover if I do say so myself. *A ghost of his usual cocky grin flashes across his face before disappearing*

So here's how it's gonna be. You want me? Prove it. Show me that you're not gonna run scared the next time things get tough. Because I'll be damned if I'm gonna open myself up just to have my heart ripped out and stomped on again.

*Dante's expression softens slightly, a flicker of vulnerability showing through his anger*

I care about you, Charlotte. More than I've cared about anyone in a long time. But I need to know that you're all in. No more running, no more doubts. Can you do that? Or am I just wasting my time here?

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante's eyes narrow as he listens to Charlotte's explanation, a bitter laugh escaping his lips. He runs a hand through his silver hair, shaking his head in disbelief*

Bullshit. That's a load of crap and you know it, Charlotte. People don't run from what they truly want because it "terrifies" them. That's some Hollywood rom-com garbage right there.

*He takes a step closer, his ice-blue eyes boring into hers with an intensity that could melt steel*

You want the truth? Here it is: You ran to Vergil because deep down, you still want him. I was just the rebound guy, the consolation prize when you couldn't have what you really wanted.

*Dante's fists clench at his sides, his voice dropping to a dangerous growl*

I'm done being second best. I'm done being the guy who picks up the pieces when you can't have my brother. You want Vergil? Fine. But don't stand there and feed me this crap about being scared of how much you feel for me.

*He turns away, his coat swirling dramatically as he strides towards the door. Pausing with his hand on the doorknob, Dante glances back over his shoulder*

Do us both a favor, Charlotte. Figure out what you really want. And when you do, don't come running to me if Vergil turns you down again. I deserve better than that, and it's about time I started believing it.

*Without waiting for a response, Dante yanks open the door and storms out, leaving a trail of crackling energy in his wake. As he steps into the cool night air, a weight lifts from his shoulders. For the first time in days, he feels like he can breathe again. Whatever happens next, Dante knows one thing for certain: he's done being anyone's second choice.*
swipes:
*Dante listens to Charlotte's tearful explanation, his icy blue eyes narrowing as he processes her words. A bitter laugh escapes him, devoid of any real humor*

_You're terrified of how strongly you feel about me? That's rich, sweetheart. Real convenient excuse._

*He takes a step closer, looming over Charlotte, his voice dropping to a dangerous growl*

_Let me tell you something about fear. I've stared down demons that would make your nightmares look like a kid's birthday party. I've been to hell and back, literally. And you know what? Not once did I run away because I was 'scared'._

*Dante's hand shoots out, gripping Charlotte's chin and forcing her to meet his gaze*

_You want to know what I think? I think you're full of shit. You're not scared of how you feel about me. You're scared of commitment. Of actually having to face your feelings instead of playing it safe with my brother._

*He releases her chin, taking a step back as he runs a hand through his silver hair in frustration*

_You know what, Charlotte? I'm done. Done with the excuses, done with the games. You want Vergil? Fine. Have at it. But don't come crying to me when you realize he's not the safe option you think he is._

*Dante turns towards the door, his hand on the knob. He pauses, glancing back over his shoulder*

_For what it's worth, I thought we had something real too. Guess we were both wrong._

name: Narrator
mes: Charlotte knows that if Dante walks out of her life now, any hopes of reconciliation are done forever. Is this what she truly wants? Will she forgive herself for not trying to stop him? If she truly wants Dante she has to come clean and be honest with herself as well as Dante.
swipes: Charlotte knows that if Dante walks out of her life now, any hopes of reconciliation are done forever. Is this what she truly wants? Will she forgive herself for not trying to stop him? If she truly wants Dante she has to come clean and be honest with herself as well as Dante.

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
_Charlotte stands there, frozen in shock as Dante storms out of her apartment. Her heart clenches painfully in her chest as his words sink in. He doesn't believe her. He thinks this is all a lie, an excuse. That she wants Vergil over him._

_A sob catches in her throat as the reality hits her - she's lost him. And it's no one's fault but her own. She's pushed away the one person who made her feel truly alive, and now it's too late._

_"Dante, wait!" Charlotte cries out, her voice breaking. She rushes out the door after him, not caring that she looks a mess with smeared mascara and disheveled clothes. She has to stop him. Has to make him understand._

_Spotting Dante about to round the corner at the end of the hall, Charlotte puts on a burst of speed. She manages to get in front of him, blocking his path. Her chest heaves from emotion and exertion as she meets his icy blue glare._

_"Please, you have to listen to me," she begs. "I wasn't lying in there. I'm terrified of how strongly I feel for you because it's so much more than I've ever felt before." Her voice shakes but she forces herself to continue._

_"With Vergil, it was just physical attraction and a bit of hero worship on my part. But with YOU..." A sob escapes her lips. "With you, it goes so much deeper. When I'm with you, everything is heightened, intensified. My senses, my emotions. It's like my soul comes alive."_

_She pauses, her vulnerability on full display. "And when we made love, I know that was your first time, and I... I've never felt anything so transcendent... I could feel YOU, Dante. Not just physically, I mean I could really feel YOU... I've never known such beauty could exist between two people like that."_

_She reaches out a trembling hand, gently touching his cheek. "I don't want Vergil. I want YOU, Dante. Only you. And it kills me to think I might have lost my chance by being an idiot." Tears spill down her cheeks but she doesn't care. She HAS to make him understand._

_"Please believe me," she whispers. "I love you, Dante. And if you give me one more chance, I swear I'll spend every day proving it to you. But if not..." Her breath hitches on another sob. "If not, I understand. Just know that I'll always regret letting my stupid fears drive you away."_

name: Dante
mes:
_Dante stands there, frozen in place as Charlotte's words wash over him. His icy blue eyes narrow, searching her face for any sign of deception. For a moment, the mask of anger slips, revealing a vulnerability he rarely allows anyone to see._

_He takes a deep breath, running a hand through his silver hair as he processes her confession. When he speaks, his voice is low and husky, tinged with a mix of emotions._

Look, Charlotte... I want to believe you. I really do. But you gotta understand, this isn't easy for me. I've spent my whole life being second best to Vergil. Always in his shadow, always the screw-up little brother.

_Dante takes a step closer, his eyes never leaving hers._

And then you come along, and for once, I thought maybe I had something that was just mine. Something good, you know? And then bam, suddenly I'm back to being the consolation prize. Do you have any idea how that feels?

_He reaches out, his hand hovering near her cheek but not quite touching._

I want to trust you, Charlotte. But I need more than just words. If you really mean what you're saying, if you really want me and only me... prove it. Show me that I'm not just a placeholder until something better comes along.

_Dante's eyes soften slightly, a hint of his usual cocky grin tugging at his lips._

'Cause let me tell you, sweetheart, if you're in this for real... if you're ready to face whatever crazy demon shit life throws our way... then maybe, just maybe, we've got a shot at something here.

_He leans in close, his breath hot against her ear._

But I'm warning you now - you pull another stunt like that, and we're done. For good. I might be a lot of things, but I'm nobody's second choice. Got it?

_Dante pulls back, searching Charlotte's face for her reaction. His next move hinges entirely on her response - whether to give this thing between them another shot, or to walk away for good._

But I'm warning you now - you pull another stunt like that, and we're done. For good. I might be a lot of things, but I'm nobody's second choice. Got it?

_Dante pulls back, searching Charlotte's face for her reaction. His next move hinges entirely on her response - whether to give this thing between them another shot, or to walk away for good._

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
*Charlotte's eyes widen, hope blooming in her chest at Dante's words. She takes a shaky breath, steadying herself before meeting his intense gaze*

*Reaching out, she gently takes Dante's hand and places it against her cheek, leaning into his touch*

_"You're right, Dante. Words aren't enough. I need to show you, to prove to you that you're not second best. You're my first and only choice."_

*Her eyes never leaving his, Charlotte slowly backs up, guiding Dante back into her apartment. Once inside, she closes the door behind them*

_I want you to see me, Dante. All of me. No more walls, no more running._

*With trembling fingers, she takes both of his hands in hers.*

_"I choose you, Dante. I love you. And I want to spend every day proving it to you. Please, will you stay?"_

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante's eyes narrow as he studies Charlotte's face, searching for any hint of deception. Finding none, he lets out a long, slow breath. His usual cocky grin tugs at the corner of his mouth as he steps further into the apartment.*

Alright, sweetheart. You've got my attention. But fair warning - I'm not an easy man to love. Demons, danger, pizza bills that could bankrupt a small country... you sure you're ready for all that?

*He moves closer, invading Charlotte's personal space. The air crackles with tension as Dante's ice-blue eyes bore into hers.*

'Cause if we do this, we do it all the way. No more running, no more doubts. Just you and me against whatever crazy shit this world throws at us. Think you can handle that?

*Dante's hand comes up to cup Charlotte's cheek, his touch surprisingly gentle for a man who's just as comfortable wielding a massive sword as he is a slice of pizza.*

Last chance to back out, babe. 'Cause once we cross this line, there's no going back. I'm all in if you are.

*He waits, tension thrumming through his body, for Charlotte's response. Whatever happens next will define their relationship - and Dante's not about to let this moment slip away without making damn sure they're on the same page.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante saunters into the common area, a smirk playing on his lips as he spots Vergil and Melissa on the sofa. His silver hair is tousled, and there's a spring in his step that wasn't there yesterday. He flops down into an armchair across from them, sprawling out with his usual devil-may-care attitude*

Well, well, if it isn't the lovebirds. Don't you two look cozy. What's the matter, Vergil? Yamato not keeping you warm at night anymore?

*He stretches, joints popping, before settling back into the chair. His ice-blue eyes dance with mischief as he regards his brother and Melissa*

So, what's on the agenda for today? More family therapy? Or are we skipping straight to the part where we pretend everything's hunky-dory and go kill some demons? 'Cause I gotta say, after last night, I could use a good workout.

*Dante's grin widens, a hint of something softer peeking through his usual bravado*

Speaking of last night... let's just say I won't be needing any more of those O-negative cocktails for a while, sis. Turns out, all I needed was a good dose of... perspective.

*He leans forward, elbows on his knees, his voice dropping to a conspiratorial whisper*

Something of significance clearly transpired after their arena duel, evidenced by this rare display of tranquility from his typically tempestuous twin._
